name: NSSpeechRecognizer
desc: The Cocoa interface to speech recognition in macOS.

items.name: delegate
items.desc: The delegate for the speech recognizer object.

items.name: commands
items.desc: An array of strings defining the commands for which the speech recognizer object should listen.

items.name: displayedCommandsTitle
items.desc: The title of the commands section in the Speech Commands window or nil if there is no title.

items.name: listensInForegroundOnly
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the speech recognizer object should only enable its commands when its application is the frontmost one.

items.name: blocksOtherRecognizers
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the speech recognizer object should block all other recognizers (that is, other applications attempting to understand spoken commands) when listening.

items.name: startListening
items.desc: Tells the speech recognition engine to begin listening for commands.

items.name: stopListening
items.desc: Tells the speech recognition engine to suspend listening for commands.
